intro: Rhinanthus alpinus subvar. erectus, commonly known as the alpine yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its erect growth habit and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Rhinanthus alpinus subvar. erectus is often found in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, nutrient-poor soils.
